title: Cloud seeding over Delhi: Trial successful, artificial rain likely soon - video
content: Delhi has initiated its first cloud-seeding trials, deploying aircraft from Kanpur to release compounds like silver iodide over areas including Burari and Karol Bagh. This initiative aims to combat severe winter air pollution by inducing artificial rain. While a recent test flight released seeding agents, insufficient atmospheric moisture prevented rainfall, highlighting the technique's dependence on specific weather conditions.

title: Delhi horror: How racy clips, rekindled romance led to murder; forensic grad scripted fiery cover-up
content: In a tale of passion turned peril, Ramkesh Meena and Amrita Chauhan found their love story interrupted by the shadow of Amrita's former flame, Sumit Kashyap. When intimate footage emerged, a desperate attempt to reclaim control spiraled into chaos with a botched robbery that ended in tragedy for Ramkesh.

title: Dual voter ID row: EC notice to Prashant Kishor over name in Bihar, Bengal rolls
content: The Election Commission has issued a notice to Jan Suraaj founder Prashant Kishor, demanding clarification within three days. Officials discovered Kishor is registered as a voter in both Bihar and West Bengal.  He is listed at the TMC headquarters in Kolkata and also in Bihar's Rohtas district, prompting the poll body's inquiry.

title: 15 wickets in 2 games! Md Shami sends a stern message to Ajit Agarkar and co
content: Mohammed Shami has made a compelling case for his return to the Indian squad with a sensational Ranji Trophy campaign for Bengal. The veteran pacer has claimed an impressive 15 wickets in just two matches, including an eight-wicket haul against Gujarat. This dominant form directly addresses recent comments from selectors regarding his need for game time.

title: 30,000 layoffs at Amazon: Managers receive email; HR division faces deepest cuts
content: Amazon initiated urgent manager training on October 27, preceding notifications to up to 30,000 corporate employees about layoffs starting the next day. These cuts, impacting nearly 10% of its corporate workforce across various divisions, represent the company's largest job reduction. The move comes amid aggressive cost-cutting and significant AI investments, with a strict return-to-office policy failing to reduce staff voluntarily.

title: 8th Pay Commission: Good news for govt employees! Cabinet approves terms of reference
content: Central government employees have reason to celebrate as the Union Cabinet approved the Terms of Reference for the 8th Pay Commission. This temporary body will review salaries and benefits, with recommendations expected within 18 months, aiming for implementation by January 1, 2026.

title: Delhi airport fire alert: Air India bus erupts in blaze near aircraft - Watch
content: A bus operated by AI SATS caught fire near an aircraft at Delhi Airport's Terminal 3 on Tuesday morning. Fortunately, the coach was empty, and no passengers were onboard at the time of the incident. The blaze was swiftly controlled, with no injuries or damage to nearby aircraft reported.

title: Watch: UP cop kicks man on camera; suspended after video goes viral
content: A viral video shows a Uttar Pradesh policeman kicking a complainant. The officer, Abhishek Kumar, was suspended after the incident, which occurred when he reacted to a man filming and speaking about oppression. The police have assured a thorough investigation into the matter.

title: 'He had a stupid moment, but I like him': Trump's 'status update' on SpaceX CEO Musk
content: Donald Trump stated he has a "good" relationship with Elon Musk, despite a "stupid moment" earlier this year.  The two, once allies, experienced a strain after Musk criticized a "Big Beautiful Bill" and later posted a cryptic tweet about Epstein files, which he subsequently deleted.

title: Mid-air drama: Indian passenger stabs two teens with fork, slaps woman
content: An Indian national, Praneeth Kumar Usiripalli, faces federal charges after allegedly stabbing two teenagers with a fork and assaulting a flight attendant on a Lufthansa flight from Chicago to Germany. The incident forced the plane to divert to Boston, where Usiripalli was apprehended. He was previously in the US on a student visa but now lacks lawful status.

title: Amazon confirms it is cutting thousands of jobs, ramps up spending on AI; read HR head's letter
content: Amazon is slashing approximately 14,000 corporate jobs, citing a need for leaner operations and faster innovation driven by AI. Senior Vice President Beth Galetti announced the cuts, emphasizing a shift towards fewer layers and increased ownership to better serve customers. This move aims to streamline the company and invest in key strategic areas.

title: IND vs AUS: 'He must perform' - Ex-India cricketer issues strong warning to Gill
content: Shubman Gill faces immense pressure in the upcoming T20I series against Australia due to his poor Asia Cup form and stiff competition from Yashasvi Jaiswal and Sanju Samson.  Head coach Gautam Gambhir's T20 World Cup plans will be scrutinized as Gill, now vice-captain, must justify the team's faith after Samson was moved down the order.

title: ChatGPT Go subscription now free: Offer starts November 4; Who are eligible users
content: OpenAI is making its ChatGPT Go subscription free for all Indian users for a year, starting November 4. This strategic move targets India, the company's second-largest and fastest-growing market, in response to aggressive user acquisition by rivals Google and Perplexity.

title: Cyclone Montha: Flights & trains cancelled, red alert issued as 3 states brace for landfall — key points
content: Cyclone Montha is set to make landfall near Kakinada tonight, bringing heavy rains and winds up to 110 kmph to Andhra Pradesh, Odisha, and northern Tamil Nadu. Authorities have initiated massive evacuations, deployed rescue teams, and are preparing for potential power and communication disruptions.

title: Big Aatmanirbhar push! Passenger aircraft to be built in India; HAL, Russia’s UAC sign pact
content: India is set to manufacture the SJ-100 civil commuter aircraft in a significant collaboration between HAL and Russia's UAC. This pact aims to boost regional air connectivity and domestic manufacturing, marking a new era for India's aviation industry. The project is expected to meet substantial demand for regional jets and foster private sector involvement.

title: Delhi set for artificial rain: What is cloud seeding? How it's done and the science behind it
content: Delhi is set to attempt artificial rainfall today. This cloud seeding operation aims to clear the city's toxic air. The trial depends on weather conditions in Kanpur. If successful, it could bring much-needed rain to wash out pollutants. This is a joint project by IIT Kanpur and the Delhi Government. It is the fourth attempt to curb severe air pollution.

title: What IS 3I/ATLAS: The Comet that’s breaking all the solar system rules
content: A peculiar interstellar visitor, 3I/ATLAS, is challenging comet theories with its sunward tail and unusual composition. While scientists explore natural explanations for its behavior, the object's unique characteristics have sparked discussions about potential non-natural origins. Continued observations are crucial to understanding its true nature and implications for distant star systems.

title: Jay-Z stands up to Donald Trump amid backlash over Bad Bunny’s Super Bowl show
content: Puerto Rican superstar Bad Bunny is set to headline Super Bowl LX, marking a historic moment as the first primarily Spanish-language solo artist. Despite some criticism, Jay-Z lauded his impact, while Bad Bunny humorously urged critics to learn Spanish. This performance promises a vibrant celebration of Latin culture on the world's biggest stage.

title: Trump sanctions: Indian refiners stop placing new orders for Russian oil; await clarity from govt
content: Indian oil refiners are halting new Russian crude orders following fresh US and EU sanctions targeting Russian energy giants. This strategic shift, driven by a need for clarity and payment facilitation, sees India increasing imports from the US and Middle Eastern nations.

title: Phil Hughes to Shreyas Iyer: A list of freak injuries on cricket field
content: India's vice-captain Shreyas Iyer is hospitalized in Sydney with a laceration injury to his spleen, sustained during a spectacular catch against Australia. The impact caused internal bleeding, leading to a sharp drop in his blood pressure. This incident adds to cricket's history of serious on-field injuries.

title: Watch: Suspect who fatally shot US cop crashes into car during high-speed chase
content: A manhunt concluded Monday after a motorcyclist, accused of fatally shooting San Bernardino County Sheriff's Deputy Andrew Nunez during a domestic violence call, crashed on the 210 Freeway. The suspect, who led authorities on a high-speed pursuit, was apprehended near Ontario. A firearm was found at the scene. The suspect's condition is currently unknown.

title: Strongest storm in 174 yrs: Video captures lightning flashes within eye of Hurricane Melissa - Watch
content: Category 5 Hurricane Melissa has stunned the world with jaw-dropping videos from its eye, captured by U.S. Air Force "Hurricane Hunters." The storm made landfall in Jamaica, bringing devastating winds and flooding, prompting the Prime Minister to call it the island's most violent in recorded history. Cuba and the Bahamas are now bracing for its impact.

title: MCX trading halted! Exchange sees tech glitch; trading in gold & silver delayed
content: The Multi Commodity Exchange (MCX) experienced a significant technical disruption on Tuesday, leading to a four-hour trading suspension. Futures contracts for key commodities like gold and silver were impacted.

title: Kenya plane crash: 12 people on board feared dead; victims mostly tourists
content: A light aircraft carrying tourists crashed in Kwale County on Tuesday morning, with at least 12 people feared dead. The plane, en route from Diani to Kichwa Tembo, went down around 8:30 am. Authorities are investigating the cause, with poor visibility and weather suspected factors.

title: Shohei Ohtani sets MLB postseason record with 4 intentional walks
content: Shohei Ohtani's historic Game 3 performance saw him become the first player intentionally walked four times in a postseason game. He also set records for multi-home run games and total bases in a single postseason.  His dominance forced the Blue Jays into unprecedented strategic concessions, highlighting his unparalleled impact on the game.

title: Techie arrested for possessing 'al-Qaida literature'; 19 laptops, 40 cellphones seized
content: A software engineer, Zubair Hangargekar, was arrested in Pune by the Maharashtra ATS for possessing al-Qaida literature. The arrest followed searches where his laptop was found with downloaded material from the banned terrorist group. Authorities are investigating his potential links to al-Qaida members and other extremist organizations.

title: Cracks in INDIA bloc? SP MLA questions Rahul‘s Jan Nayak’ title; prefers Akhilesh Yadav
content: Samajwadi Party MLA Ravidas Mehrotra criticized the Congress for calling Rahul Gandhi 'jan nayak,' asserting that the INDIA bloc will collectively decide on leadership. This statement comes amid a political row in Bihar over the title 'Jan Nayak,' with parties clashing over its use for Karpoori Thakur and Rahul Gandhi.

title: Shreyas Iyer injured: Surya provides update; India prepares for T20I series
content: Shreyas Iyer is recovering well in Sydney after a spleen injury sustained during a catch in the third ODI against Australia. Captain Suryakumar Yadav confirmed Iyer is responding and medically stable, though he will be monitored. This unfortunate incident casts doubt on his availability for the upcoming South Africa series, impacting India's middle-order plans.

title: OpenAI’s Chats for Students in India: What’s inside; how it works
content: OpenAI's new initiative, Chats for Students in India, offers a prompt library showcasing how Indian students are already integrating generative AI into their studies. This collection of 56 student-created prompts demonstrates AI's role in learning, project development, and career planning, emphasizing responsible use as a tool rather than a replacement for critical thinking.

title: Auqib Nabi's story: Father wanted him to be a doctor; 'qismat' changed plans
content: From curfew-hit Baramulla to tormenting batters in domestic cricket, Auqib Nabi’s rise has been nothing short of inspirational. The bowler who once borrowed spikes for trials, now dreams of donning India colours. Mentored by Irfan Pathan and inspired by Parvez Rasool, Nabi’s story is a tale of perseverance, patience, and unwavering belief in destiny

title: Did Dodgers-Blue Jays showdown set record for longest game in World Series history?
content: The 2025 World Series saw the Los Angeles Dodgers and Toronto Blue Jays engage in a grueling 16-inning Game 3, marking the second-longest World Series game ever. This marathon contest at Dodger Stadium followed the record-setting 18-inning Game 3 from 2018, also featuring the Dodgers, solidifying their place in baseball's endurance history.

title: Kuwait mandates strict new salon and beauty parlour rules
content: Kuwait’s Ministry of Health has introduced new regulations for salons and beauty parlours under Decision No. 194/2025, enforcing stricter hygiene and safety standards. All establishments must comply by March 1, 2026, or face penalties or closure. The rules mandate enhanced sanitation, staff training, sterilisation, and ventilation to align Kuwait’s beauty sector with global health standards.

title: Bengaluru horror: Delivery agent molests Brazilian model; held
content: A 22-year-old grocery delivery agent was arrested in Bengaluru for allegedly sexually harassing a Brazilian model at her city flat. The accused, Kumar, touched the woman inappropriately while delivering groceries. The incident was confirmed by CCTV footage, leading to his arrest and judicial custody.

title: 'Everything is true': Japan's ex-PM killer pleads guilty; blames Abe for family's financial ruin
content: Tetsuya Yamagami admitted to the murder of former Prime Minister Shinzo Abe, stating "Everything is true" during his trial. Yamagami blamed Abe for supporting the Unification Church, which he accused of financially ruining his family. The assassination exposed deep ties between the ruling party and the church, leading to a collapse in public trust.

title: 5 morning habits that can quietly harm your kidneys, according to experts
content: Morning habits like not drinking water, holding your bladder, taking painkillers on an empty stomach, skipping rehydration after exercise, and skipping breakfast can silently harm your kidneys. These seemingly small actions put significant stress on these vital organs over time, impacting their ability to filter waste and maintain overall health.

title: Student suicides in India: SC’s 8-week compliance clock; can campuses heal?
content: The Supreme Court has given states and the Centre eight weeks to report on student mental health guideline enforcement. This directive follows a rise in student suicides, highlighting a mental health crisis. Coaching centres must now register and provide student support. The Court expects tangible progress by January 2026, aiming for a nationwide law on student well-being.

title: Tata Trusts tussle: Majority votes for Mehli Mistry’s ouster; once Ratan Tata’s close aide
content: Mehli Mistry's tenure as a trustee at Tata Trusts appears to be ending as key figures Noel Tata, Venu Srinivasan, and Vijay Singh have not approved his term extension. This decision, made by a majority of trustees, signals a significant shift within the prestigious Tata group.

title: 'How long have you known?': King Charles heckled, questioned on Prince Andrew - Watch
content: During a cathedral visit, King Charles faced a heckler questioning his knowledge of Prince Andrew's Epstein connections. The protester's shouts intensified following renewed scrutiny over Andrew's past and Giuffre's memoir. Despite the disruption, the King continued greeting royal fans, ignoring the disruptive individual.

title: Delhi pollution: Hourly update on AQI returns after glitch; air quality remains 'very poor'
content: Delhi's air quality remained in the 'very poor' category with an AQI of 301, marred by technical glitches that disrupted data updates. Despite the smog, stubble burning contributed minimally. Authorities are now planning cloud seeding to induce artificial rain amid forecasts of light showers, hoping to improve the air.

title: Hit by US sanctions, Russia’s Lukoil to sell overseas assets; why was it targeted?
content: Russian oil giant Lukoil is divesting its international operations following US sanctions imposed due to Moscow's actions in Ukraine. The sanctions, which freeze US assets and bar American firms from doing business with Lukoil and Rosneft, have prompted the company to begin selling its global assets. This move comes as peace negotiations between Russia and Ukraine remain stalled.

title: ‘No Muslims in Mustafabad’: Yogi announces renaming village to Kabir Dham; cites heritage restoration
content: Uttar Pradesh Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath announced that Mustafabad village in Lakhimpur Kheri will be renamed Kabir Dham after learning no Muslim families reside there. He stated the renaming aims to restore the village's heritage, contrasting it with past name changes he deemed religiously motivated. The proposal for the renaming is being expedited.

title: Hurricane Melissa unleashes fury: Strongest storm of 2025; Caribbean on edge
content: Hurricane Melissa, a Category 5 storm with winds nearing 280 km/h, is threatening Jamaica with catastrophic flooding and storm surges. The "potentially catastrophic" cyclone underwent explosive intensification due to exceptionally warm ocean waters. Authorities have ordered evacuations and closed airports as the storm inches closer to the island's southern coast.

title: US-India ties: Ex-US commerce secretary slams Trump’s approach; calls it 'big mistake'
content: Former US Commerce Secretary Gina Raimondo criticized Donald Trump's "America First" policies, warning that the US is alienating allies and making a mistake with India. She argued that an isolationist approach weakens US global influence and that other nations, like China, are actively filling the void left by American disengagement.

title: 7 months pregnant Delhi cop lifts 145kg in weightlifting championship - watch
content: Delhi Police constable Sonika Yadav, seven months pregnant, won a bronze medal at the All India Police Weightlifting Cluster. She lifted a combined 145 kg, concealing her pregnancy until her final deadlift. Her achievement highlights courage and consistency, proving determination can overcome barriers.

title: Charlie Kirk’s daughter spots her late father’s poster in emotional video
content: A touching Instagram video shared by Erika Kirk, widow of Charlie Kirk, shows their three-year-old daughter joyfully recognizing her late father's poster. The innocent exclamation, "I see Daddy!" resonated globally, highlighting love's enduring power. Erika reflected on how their daughter embodies Charlie's legacy, proving that love transcends loss and lives on through children.

title: Kerala CM, Leader of the Opposition decry ECI’s voters’ list revision as politically motivated
content: Pinarayi Vijayan says a revision based on the 2002-2004 voters list violates the Representation of the People Act, 1950, and the Registration of Electors Rules, 1960, which mandate using current voters’ list.

title: J&K recorded over 2 lakh dog bite cases in past three years: Govt
content: According to data, Jammu district reported the highest number of cases during the period under review at 54,889, followed by Srinagar city with 36,406 cases

title: District reorganization to reflect public aspirations and administrative efficiency: Naidu
content: The Chief Minister directed officials and ministers to resolve issues that arose from the previous government’s unscientific district formation and to ensure that no new complications arise

title: Deadline nears, but J.C. Road white-topping work in Bengaluru far from over
content: The uneven surface and open ditches on J.C. Road have made commuting difficult and caused daily traffic snarls, while also adversely impacting business.

title: High Court judge refuses to recuse from hearing Madras Race Club case
content: The club had feared bias as the judge had passed adverse orders against it in another case and had also appeared against the club in two cases during his stint as a lawyer

title: Community in shock after Indian-origin woman's 'racially aggravated' rape in Walsall, U.K.
content: ‘The racially aggravated rape in Walsall is a horrific crime. My thoughts are with the victim and her family,’ says U.K. Home Secretary Shabana Mahmood

title: Social media sparring between Karnataka’s IT-BT Minister Priyank Kharge and Assam CM Himanta Biswa Sarma continues
content: Citing an X post by Mr. Sarma that was posted in March 2024, Mr. Kharge pointed out that by the former’s own admission, thousands of Assamese were being trained in Bengaluru

title: Cyclone Montha: Indian Railways cancels 32 trains to ensure passenger safety
content: Local MEMUs and other trains scheduled to depart on October 28 have been cancelled, says Deepak Rout CPRO East Coast Railway

title: Montha cyclone: Andhra CM Chandrababu Naidu orders preventive measures drawing lessons from past
content: Deputy CM Pawan Kalyan, Ministers Nara Lokesh, V. Anitha, P. Narayana, Chief Secretary K. Vijayanand, and senior officials from various departments participated in the review meeting

title: Ajaneesh Loknath interview: A deep-dive into the music of Rishab Shetty’s ‘Kantara: Chapter 1’
content: Calling ‘Kantara: Chapter 1’ his toughest project yet, music composer Ajaneesh Loknath opens up on creating a rich soundtrack for the hit prequel and explains how Rishab Shetty’s passion for music enhances storytelling

title: How Kerala’s Messi dream faded amid stadium row | Explained
content: Kerala’s plans to host Lionel Messi and the Argentina team for a friendly have collapsed amid controversy over Kochi’s Jawaharlal Nehru International Stadium. As the stadium undergoes renovation, questions linger about the legality of handing over public assets to private entities

title: Cyclone Montha: Nadendla Manohar urges Jana Sena leaders, cadres to lead relief efforts
content: Nadendla Manohar emphasised that the party’s field-level volunteers must work with a clear action plan to prevent loss of lives

title: Cotton procurement centres to open from Wednesday in A.P.
content: The government would  ensure that farmers receive the Minimum Support Price (MSP) of ₹8,110 per quintal as fixed by the Centre, Minister for Agriculture K Atchannaidu said

title: Union Cabinet approves the terms of reference for the 8th Pay Commission
content: The Central Pay Commission will make its recommendations within 18 months of the date of its constitution

title: Maritime security can no longer be viewed through narrow prism of threat containment: Navy chief
content: The Navy is hosting the three-day conclave at the Manekshaw Centre from October 28-30, with several naval officers and experts from various countries taking part in it

title: Nature, not man, uprooted the Himalayan logs seen floating in flood waters: Himachal assures Supreme Court
content: The logs accumulated in the banks of both rivers were “naturally fallen or decayed trees and salvage debris”

title: Karur stampede victim’s wife returns ₹20-lakh ‘compensation’ given by Vijay
content: The woman said she was upset because Mr. Vijay did not visit her in Karur to offer his condolences. Instead, he had invited the families to a private resort in Mamallapuram.

title: Air India bus catches fire at Delhi Airport, no casualty
content: The coach is seen parked very close to an aircraft. AI SATS provides services to multiple airlines, including Air India

title: Of Nitish, Lalu, and a time to be with the masses, again
content: From comrades in the JP Movement to bitter rivals, and partners in government, Nitish Kumar and Lalu Prasad have hovered the political landscape of Bihar for five decades

title: Woman alleges assault at nightclub in Kolkata five-star hotel
content: The businessman, identified as Naser Khan, who had earlier served a prison term in a gang rape case before being released in 2020, says the police

title: Tension escalates at Elappully in Kerala over brewery as CPI(M) lays siege to panchayat office
content: CPI(M) workers, who back the project, laid siege to panchayat office, preventing officials from attending a scheduled governing council meeting convened to oppose the brewery

title: Karnataka High Court stays State Government’s order regulating activities of private organisations on public land
content: The petitioner has argued that recent Government Order, which mandates permission for gatherings of more than 10 people, is a violation of the fundamental rights granted under the Constitution

title: Telangana CM Revanth calls on Sringeri seer, updates on Vemulawada development
content: CM briefed the seer on the development works being undertaken at the Vemulawada temple in Karimnagar District.

title: Raj Thackeray-led MNS releases teaser for rally in Mumbai against Election Commission on November 1
content: The teaser shows MNS chief Raj Thackeray warning that no election will be held in Maharashtra until the voters’ list is cleaned

title: First cloud-seeding trial conducted in parts of Delhi
content: The trial, aimed at inducing artificial rain to tackle air pollution in the capital, is part of the Delhi government’s broader strategy to mitigate deteriorating air quality during the winter months

title: Election Commission's SIR plan a threat to democracy, says Kerala CM Pinarayi Vijayan
content: Pinarayi says the move raises doubts about the poll panel's intentions and warns that it can undermine public trust in the electoral system

title: Cyclone Montha: Thailand names storm; IMD outlines naming rules
content: “The IMD announces the names once the wind speed of the cyclone reaches 65 kmh,” senior meteorologist Kumar told The Hindu

title: Setting up early warning in the Himalaya poses unique challenges
content: Climate change and development have made the Himalayas acutely vulnerable to floods, landslides and lakebursts, killing hundreds. Why are early warning systems not a priority?

title: Woman Plotted Partner's Murder Over Hard Disk. It Had Nudes Of 15 Others
content: Ram Kesh Meena's charred body was recovered on October 6 from a flat in north Delhi's Timarpur area after a massive blaze. As the police started investigating the case, a chilling conspiracy came to light.

title: 'India's First Drive-Through Hand Pump' In Madhya Pradesh Goes Viral
content: Madhya Pradesh is a land where surprises lie under every stone, or in this case, right in the middle of the road. In Sidhi district's Dol Kothar village, a hand pump is in the centre of a newly built Pradhan Mantri Gram Sadak Yojana road.

title: China, ASEAN Sign Upgraded Free Trade Pact Amid Global Trade Tensions
content: The Southeast Asian bloc ASEAN and China on Tuesday signed an upgrade to their free trade agreement, which is expected to include sections on digital, green economy, and other new industries.

title: Maharashtra Ex Minister Leads Tractor March To Nagpur Over Loan Waiver For Farmers
content: Prahar Janshakti Party chief and former MLA Bachchu Kadu on Monday launched a large tractor march from Maharashtra's Amravati district toward Nagpur, demanding a complete loan waiver for farmers.

title: Beef, Defence Deals, And Rare Earths: How Japan's New Leader Wooed Trump
content: Japan pulled out all stops for this week's visit by US President Donald Trump -- his first with new Prime Minister Sanae Takaichi.

title: Madhya Pradesh To Borrow Rs 5,200 Crore, Month After Rs 3,000-Crore Loan
content: Days before Madhya Pradesh celebrates its Foundation Day on November 1, the state government, led by Chief Minister Dr Mohan Yadav, is preparing to take yet another loan, this time to the tune of Rs 5,200 crore.

title: Main Accused In Durgapur Gang Rape Identified, Classmate Among Co-Accused
content: The main accused of the gang rape of a second year medical student in West Bengal's Durgapur was identified as Firdous Sheikh, while five others were named co-accused.

title: Pakistan-Afghanistan Peace Talks Hosted By Turkey Hit Impasse In Istanbul
content: Peace talks between Pakistan and Afghanistan have hit an impasse in Istanbul after three days of negotiations, with state media in both countries blaming each other for the failure to reach a deal while efforts by Turkey were still underway.

title: AI vs Humans: How Elon Musk's Grokipedia Differs From Rival Wikipedia
content: At first glance, Grokipedia looks familiar. It has a search bar, a minimalist design, and font styles like Wikipedia. But it runs on a fundamentally different model.

title: Opinion: Opinion | 95% Of Gen-AI Projects Are Failing - And Markets Can Smell The Fear
content: Many firms are struggling to display profits from their AI investment. A new MIT study revealed that approximately 95% of generative AI business efforts are failing, with only 5% achieving meaningful revenue growth.

title: Gujarat Tourists Dine And Dash Without Paying Rs 10,900, Caught In Traffic
content: A group of five tourists, including a woman, checked into the Happy Day Hotel in Siyava, near Mount Abu in Rajasthan. They ordered a bunch of items and had a hearty meal. But when it was time to clear the bill of Rs 10,900, they decided to skip out.

title: Can Donald Trump Serve A Third Term As US President?
content: President Donald Trump on Monday declined to dismiss speculation that he would seek a third term and said he hadn't considered whether he would go to court to contest the US Constitution's two-term limit for presidents.

title: Bike Taxi Rider Arrested For Molesting, Robbing Woman Passenger In Delhi
content: A 28-year-old bike taxi rider has been arrested for allegedly molesting a woman passenger and robbing her after diverting the route towards a secluded stretch in east Delhi, police said on Tuesday.

title: Watch: US Air Force Flies Into Eye Of Hurricane Melissa, Strongest Storm Of 2025
content: The mission, conducted by the USAF's famed "Hurricane Hunters," was to gather meteorological data for the US National Hurricane Center as the Category 5 system moved towards Jamaica.

title: "Society Won't Forgive Us": Supreme Court On Doctors' Covid Compensation Case
content: The top court directed the Centre to provide relevant data and information regarding other similar or parallel schemes available apart from the Pradhan Mantri Insurance Scheme.

title: Prashant Kishor Listed As Voter In Both Bihar, West Bengal
content: Poll strategist-turned-politician Prashant Kishor figures in the electoral rolls of both Bihar and West Bengal, an election official said on Tuesday.

title: Karnataka's Order On Public Gatherings Paused Amid Tussle With RSS
content: Karnataka had issued an order that mandated prior permission for gatherings of over 10 people in public spaces, amid a tussle with the RSS.

title: Video: Bus Metres Away From Air India Plane At Delhi Airport's T3 Catches Fire
content: The Delhi International Airport Ltd (DIAL), which operates the Indira Gandhi International Airport, called it a "stray incident" and said that there were no injuries.

title: Flight Attendant Dies By Suicide In Hyderabad
content: A 28-year-old cabin crew member of a private airline allegedly died by suicide at her rented flat in Rajendranagar here, police said on Tuesday.

title: "I See Daddy": Charlie Kirk's Daughter Spots Father's Poster On Street
content: As the car drove by the Turning Point USA headquarters, Charlie Kirk's daughter eagerly pointed at the poster and said, "I see Daddy!".

title: Montha cyclone: Nine trains originating in Visakhapatnam cancelled on October 28
content: Passengers and the general public are advised to check with respective railway inquiry offices or in official website for the latest updates on train operations

title: Cyclone Montha brings widespread, intense downpour over north Tamil Nadu
content: The storm, however, has slowed down slightly, moving at a speed of 10 kmph compared to its earlier pace of 15 kmph

title: HAL and Russia’s UAC join hands for production of civil jet SJ-100
content: Under the arrangement, HAL will have the rights to manufacture SJ-100 aircraft for domestic customers.

title: Odisha Chief Minister takes part in Chhath Puja celebrations with devotees
content: “Praying to ‘Chhathi Maiya’ and Sun god for the prosperity of the State, happiness, and peace of all the people of Odisha. May everyone's life be auspicious in this great festival of social harmony,” says CM Mohan Charan Majhi

title: Montha cyclone damages two roads in Andhra’s Bapatla district
content: Further, more than 5,407 people were shifted into 119 cyclone rehabilitation centres in Bapatla district

title: Major bureaucratic reshuffle in West Bengal ahead of SIR; DMs, SDOs transferred
content: While the ruling dispensation has termed this reshuffle as routine, BJP alleged “violation of the ECI guidelines”

title: Controversial Kerala Prisons dept letter on ‘release’ of T.P. Chandrasekharan murder case convicts sparks political row
content: Letter seeks a report on potential security issues central to ‘possible release on parole’ of CPI(M) ‘activists’ serving time for 2012 murder of RMP leader

title: Workers unions, political parties welcome Supreme Court order on resumption of MGNREGS in West Bengal
content: Paschim Banga Khet Majoor Samity, a union of agricultural workers that has approached the Courts over resumption of MGNREGS in West Bengal, said that the Supreme Court order marks a decisive victory for Bengal’s rural workers and a resounding affirmation that the Right to Work cannot be denied or delayed

title: Cyclone Montha: Life thrown out of gear in Vizianagaram, Srikakulam districts
content: Most people remained indoors with the fear of the cyclonic storm which had already caused damage to standing crops and roads

title: Watch: Cyclone Montha to hit Andhra Coast tonight | Red alert in 16 districts
content: Cyclone Montha is set to make landfall between Machilipatnam and Kalingapatnam near Kakinada tonight as a severe cyclonic storm. The IMD has issued a red alert for 16 districts in Andhra Pradesh, warning of winds up to 110 kmph and heavy rainfall. Thousands have been evacuated, and CM Chandrababu Naidu has ordered zero-casualty preparedness.

title: APSSDC announces overseas placements for Mechatronics technicians in Germany
content: Selected candidates will be offered employment in Germany with a monthly salary of approximately Euro 2,500 to Euro 3,000, along with 30 days paid leave and a 2-year contract

title: SIR in West Bengal: Booth Level Officers call for added security measures against ‘threats’
content: Officers remain apprehensive about participating in the new SIR process citing safety issues and hindrance in work caused by various “political factions”

title: Cyclone Montha: SCR Vijayawada division cancels 54 trains
content: Control rooms set up to ensure round-the-clock monitoring; officials told to monitor bridges, operation of trains and the situation at vulnerable locations

title: Montha intensifies into severe cyclonic storm; IMD issues red alert for coasts of Andhra, Odisha
content: Heavy to very heavy rains with isolated extremely heavy rainfall are likely in the districts of Tirupati, SPSR Nellore, Prakasam, Bapatla, Krishna, Guntur, NTR, Palnadu and North Coastal Andhra Pradesh

title: Devotees offer morning prayers at ghats across Bihar on last day of Chhath Puja
content: The devotees gathered on the banks of the Ganga and other water bodies in Patna since early morning to offer ‘Usha Arghya’ to the rising sun

title: Cyclone ‘Montha’: APSRTC on high alert, emergency measures in place
content: Officials have been instructed to avoid unnecessary operations and cancel night-halt services in areas expected to be affected by the cyclone

title: After JD(U), RJD expels several party leaders for ‘anti-party’ activities during poll
content: After ruling party JD(U), now Opposition Rashtriya Janata Dal has expelled over two dozen party leaders, including party’s State women cell president over their “anti-party activities” in elections

title: Cloudy sky fails to dim devotion in Hyderabad as prayers offered to rising sun on Chhath Puja’s last day
content: Despite the cloudy skies delaying the sunrise, devotees stood patiently in waist-deep water with baskets of fruits and soop (offerings) in hand

title: Why do cyclones move towards land? | Explained
content: If the global geography were reversed or if the trade winds blew the other way, cyclones would rarely make landfall

title: Traffic diversions in Hyderabad’s Yousufguda for Telugu film industry federation meeting on October 28
content: Moderate traffic congestion is anticipated in and around the Kotla Vijaya Bhaskar Reddy Indoor  stadium from 10 a.m. to 4 p.m.

title: Is the Dogri language losing resonance in India?
content: Is the Dogri language declining at the same rate across rural and urban landscapes in the Jammu region?

title: Bihar Assembly election LIVE: INDIA bloc releases election manifesto
content: "Delhi Chief Minister Rekha Gupta will be in Bihar to campaign for the Assembly elections scheduled for next month,” officials said

title: Heavy metals in Cauvery fish, study warns against regular intake
content: While occasional fish consumption may not pose immediate threats, prolonged exposure could lead to cumulative non-carcinogenic and carcinogenic risks

title: Kangana gets bail in defamation case, says regrets 'misunderstanding', respects every mother
content: The defamation case stems from a retweet the actor made with her own comment on Mahinder Kaur, the 73-year-old complainant from Bahadurgarh Jandian village in Punjab's Bathinda district

title: Most people extradited to India are economic offenders: data
content: More than a third (35%) of those extradited to India since 2002 were accused of financial fraud, cheating, and forgery

title: Cyclone Montha LIVE updates: Severe cyclonic storm 70 km away from Machilipatnam
content: Cyclone Montha to cross Andhra Pradesh coast around Kakinada during the evening/night today (October 28, 2025), with a maximum wind speed of 90-100 kmph gusting to 110 kmph

title: Woman doctor's death in Satara: Family demands SIT, trial in Beed court
content: The complaints made by the woman doctor in the past were not heeded, and a fresh inquiry should be held into them, said a relative

title: Will take legal action against EC once in power: Uddhav Thackeray
content: The slew of allegations against the EC has surfaced in Maharashtra ahead of the upcoming local body elections

title: Unseasonal rains push Maharashtra’s onion farmers to indefinite protest
content: Unseasonal rains have devastated onion nurseries across Maharashtra, triggering indefinite farmer protests.

title: Tripura online activist held for “abusing” State govt.
content: Madhavi Biswas, a resident of Pratapgarh in Agartala, has spoken about alleged corruption in the State government and lack of civic amenities.

title: CPI Ministers to boycott Cabinet demanding withdrawal from PM SHRI pact
content: CPI general secretary D. Raja calls Chief Minister Pinarayi Vijayan’s reasons for joining the contentious scheme unconvincing.  Kerala government should have taken its cue from Tamil Nadu and moved the Supreme Court for unconditional and obligatory federal funding for education, he says

title: BJP hits out at Opposition over its stand on SIR 2.0
content: BJP national spokesperson Shehzad Poonawalla alleged that Congress and other Opposition parties are targeting the Election Commission and using the SIR as an excuse for the “impending losses” in the coming polls

title: INDIA bloc to release poll manifesto on October 28; Rahul to join campaign
content: Rahul Gandhi to hold his first election campaign in Muzaffarpur and Darbhanga on October 29; Tejashwi slams the Central government and accuses it of “telling lies” about running special trains during Chhath

title: Congress high command will decide on changing Chief Minister, says Siddaramaiah
content: Amid speculation over the change of leadership and Deputy Chief Minister D.K. Shivakumar’s visit to Delhi, Chief Minister Siddaramaiah in Mangaluru reiterated that the Congress high command will take a call on whether or not to continue him as the Chief Minister

title: Muhammad Yunus sparks controversy with controversial map on book presented to Pakistan military general
content: The map in question was printed on the cover of a book that was presented to Chairman of Pakistan’s Joint Chiefs of Staff Committee (CJCSC) General Sahir Shamshad Mirza

title: Experts link fatal mudslip to poor road stability measures in Idukki
content: Experts blame unscientific slope cutting practices for landslips on the the Kochi-Dhanushkodi stretch.

title: Trinamool softens stand on SIR, says will democratically protest if genuine voters are removed
content: The CPI(M) urged transparency in Special Intensive Revision of voter lists, whereas the Congress sought that all-party meetings be convened both at the State and Central level

title: Only God will do justice, says father of Bihar youth jailed for abusing PM during Rahul Gandhi’s Voter Adhikar Yatra
content: Mohammed Rizvi’s only crime is his poor family background, he had been coaxed into committing the mistake, says his father, who runs a small two-wheeler repair shop at Bharwara village; he says the police haven’t given him a copy of the FIR and he lacks the resources to hire a lawyer for his son

title: Dodgers win WS classic on Freeman's HR in 18th
content: Freddie Freeman once again lifted the Dodgers with a walk-off home run in a World Series, this time in the 18th inning of Game 3 against the Blue Jays on Monday night.

title: Blue Jays plan to keep walking red-hot Ohtani
content: The Blue Jays turned to walking Shohei Ohtani, who reached base a record nine times in Game 3, after he went 4-for-4 in the early innings.

title: Springer exits with injury; Jays await MRI results
content: Blue Jays designated hitter George Springer left Game 3 of the World Series after suffering an injury on a swing in the top of the seventh inning Monday night.

title: Flagg hurts shoulder, is benched in crunch time
content: Mavericks rookie Cooper Flagg injured his left shoulder on the opening possession of Monday night's loss and spent the vast majority of crunch time watching from the bench due to a coach's decision.

title: Kelce ties Chiefs TD mark with vintage night
content: Travis Kelce led the Chiefs to a comfortable win over the Commanders with six receptions on eight targets for 99 yards -- and his 83rd career touchdown, which tied former running back Priest Holmes for the most total touchdowns in franchise history.

title: Markkanen 1st Jazz player to top 50 since Malone
content: Lauri Markkanen scored a career-high 51 points, the first Jazz player to reach 50 in the regular season since Karl Malone in 1998, and Utah beat Phoenix 138-134 in overtime Monday night.

title: Sources: Broncos CB Surtain expected out weeks
content: Broncos cornerback Pat Surtain II is expected to miss multiple games with a left pectoral strain and could be a candidate for injured reserve, sources told ESPN on Monday.

title: Maxey, Edgecombe off to historic start for Sixers
content: Tyrese Maxey and VJ Edgecombe have combined for 186 points, the most by a starting backcourt in a team's first three games of a season since 1970-71.

title: Kelce has season-best performance in win over Commanders

title: Barnwell makes sense of Week 8: One key takeaway from each of Sunday's 11 games

title: How the FBI says poker games were rigged
content: the case focused on rigged poker games is one of two announced that allegedly involve prominent NBA figures . investigators state that the scheme began in April 2019 when defendant Robert "Black Rob" Stroud and other co-conspirators devised a ruse to use technology to rig illegal poker games against unwitting, wealthy players . in many cases, every other person at the poker table at the same time believed these were "straight" games against other wealthy players.

title: Passan: 18 innings, 11 runs, a walk-off homer -- and an epic Game 3
